events.description: Framed the Blackjack AI problem as a supervised learning task. Collected and analyzed data using a Blackjack simulator. Defined the objective of building an AI model that maximizes cumulative rewards over games.

Performed data analysis to identify correlations, outliers, and missing values. Decided on the relevant features for training the model: dealer's visible card, initial hand, final hand, and actions taken.
Removed unnecessary columns and rows with irrelevant actions. Enhanced the data by breaking down games into individual actions and encoding categorical variables using one-hot and ordinal encoding.
Designed multiple model architectures for training: XGBoost, Feedforward Neural Networks, and Recurrent Neural Networks. Split the dataset into training, validation, and test sets.

Started training multiple models (XGBoost, Feedforward Neural Networks, and Recurrent Neural Networks). Applied data preprocessing, including feature scaling, encoding, and splitting into training and test sets. Focused on training the models to predict optimal Blackjack actions based on game states.

Evaluated the performance of XGBoost, Feedforward Neural Networks, and Recurrent Neural Networks. Assessed accuracy, confusion matrices, and feature importance to compare model strengths and weaknesses.
Refined the models based on evaluation results. Adjusted hyperparameters and fine-tuned the neural network architectures to improve prediction accuracy and action classification.
Selected the best-performing model based on evaluation metrics. Finalized the model for deployment and further testing.

Led the cloud team during the initial planning phase, introducing the vision for the Smart Pet Feeder. Coordinated the project following Scrum methodology, organizing tasks and ensuring alignment with business goals.

events.milestone: Requirement Gathering and Cloud Architecture Design
events.description: Collected requirements from stakeholders and designed the cloud infrastructure. Defined the architecture for scalability, data processing, and real-time pet feeding data synchronization.
Set up the cloud infrastructure, focusing on high availability and security. Implemented cloud solutions for user data, activity logs, and feeding schedule synchronization.
Led backend API development, focusing on connecting the smart pet feeders with the cloud. Integrated user authentication and developed endpoints for feeding schedules and health insights.
Integrating Arduino with the cloud API. Ensured remote feeding functionality and addressed integration challenges between hardware and cloud services.
Focused on cloud API integration for real-time communication with the pet feeder devices. Implemented seamless data exchange and synchronization for accurate feeding schedules.
Focus on testing. Worked with the both Frontend and IoT teams to resolve issues, optimize API endpoints, and ensure smooth interaction between the feeder and cloud systems.
Deployed the system to production and tested its scalability. Optimized the cloud infrastructure to handle a growing number of users and devices in real-time.
Developed user guides and API documentation on system setup, feeding schedule configuration, and troubleshooting. Created detailed documentation for pet owners and stakeholders.

title: Pnta üéâ

events.description: Started with the design phase, focusing on user experience for both the app and manager platform. Developed wireframes, user flows, and UI mockups to ensure intuitive interfaces. The design phase also included architecture planning for scalable microservices.

Developed the backend architecture, creating the base for both the app and manager platforms. Set up databases, APIs, and microservices to enable flexible communication between the two systems. The backend supports user data management and administrative functionality.

Built the manager platform, an admin interface for overseeing user activity, generating reports, and managing system data. The platform provides tools for admins to monitor and interact with user activity, with integrated alerting and notifications.
Started coding the app platform, focusing on user interaction features such as registration, login, and venues display. Integrated APIs for seamless data synchronization between the app and backend.
Integrated the frontend UI with backend APIs, ensuring smooth user experience across platforms. Focused on real-time data updates and syncing data between the user app and manager platform.

alert: This project is still in development. Progress has been temporarily paused.

title: Smart Vision üì¶

events.description: Kicked off the project by gathering domain-specific knowledge and exploring available datasets. This phase was crucial for understanding both the problem space and the constraints defined by our partners.
Evaluated multiple computer vision models and frameworks. Chose a YOLOv9-based architecture due to its balance between speed and accuracy, and its compatibility with real-time inference.

Conducted extensive preprocessing of raw image data including normalization, labeling, and data augmentation techniques. Emphasis was placed on improving class balance and increasing model generalization.

To support model performance in edge-case scenarios, an active learning loop was implemented. This allowed the model to request human input on uncertain predictions, resulting in more efficient training cycles.

Currently in the testing phase, focused on evaluating model performance using standard CV metrics (mAP, IoU, precision/recall). Hyperparameter tuning is ongoing to optimize inference speed and accuracy under real-world constraints.

The project is currently in its final stages, focusing on deployment and preparing technical documentation. Efforts include model integration into the target environment, API wrapping, and writing developer and user-facing documentation for future maintenance.

alert: This project is under NDA. Limited details are shared out of respect for confidentiality agreements.
note: This project is now complete on my side and will be continued by Beumer.

title: Riga Cup ‚öΩ

events.description: Received a freelance offer to develop the Riga Cup system. Designed the overall system architecture, focusing on scalability and performance. The goal was to build a robust platform for tournament and team management.

Started developing the backend for the Riga Cup system, including the database schema, API endpoints, and authentication logic. Managed the backend infrastructure and led a team to implement the system.
Collaborated with the frontend team to integrate the backend API with the user interface. Ensured smooth data exchange between the frontend and backend systems.
Conducted extensive testing of the system, identifying and fixing bugs in the tournament and team management features. Focused on user experience and system performance.
Optimized system performance by refining code, improving database queries, and reducing server load. Enhanced scalability and efficiency for large tournaments.
Deployed the backend system to production. Monitored initial user activity and system performance to ensure stability.

alert: Source code not available due to privacy concerns. üòî
